From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • piescar (Eastern Asturias)
  • piscar (Miranda)
  • apescar

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin piscārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pesˈkaɾ/ [pesˈkaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pes‧car

Verb

[edit]

pescar (first-person singular indicative present pesco, past participle pescáu)

  1. to fish
  2. (colloquial) to catch (someone who's moving)
    Synonyms: alcanzar, coyer
  3. (colloquial) to catch, hunt
  4. (colloquial) to grab something that's thrown
    Hypernym: coyer
  5. (colloquial) to get a cold
  6. (colloquial) to run over
    Synonym: coyer
  7. (colloquial) to surprise (someone doing something)
    Synonym: sosprender
  8. (colloquial) to get
    Synonyms: consiguir, llograr, pescanciar
  9. (colloquial) to realize, understand
    Synonyms: pescanciar, decatar, catar

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of pescar
infinitive pescar
gerund pescando
past participle m pescáu, f pescada, n pescao, m pl pescaos, f pl pescaes

Related terms

[edit]

Catalan

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • peixcar

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin piscārī, a verb based on piscis (“fish”, noun).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [pəsˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [pesˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

pescar (first-person singular present pesco, first-person singular preterite pesquí, past participle pescat); root stress: (Central) /ɛ/; (Valencia) /e/; (Balearic) /ə/

  1. (ambitransitive) to fish
  2. (transitive, figurative) to land; to catch
    pescar la grip ― to catch the flu

preterite pesquí pescares pescà pescàrem pescàreu pescaren

Derived terms

[edit]
  • pesca
  • pescaclics
  • pescada
  • pescaire
  • pescallar
  • pescamines
  • pesquer

Related terms

[edit]
  • peix
  • pescador
  • piscar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “pescar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “pescar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “pescar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “pescar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Galician-Portuguese pescar, from Latin piscārī. Compare Portuguese pescar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pesˈkaɾ/

Verb

[edit]

pescar (first-person singular present pesco, first-person singular preterite pesquei, past participle pescado)

  1. to fish
    Non se pescan troitas con bragas enxoitas (proverb) ― You won't fish trouts with dry pants
  2. (figurative) to catch, grasp; capture
    Synonyms: cachar, capturar, coller
    • 1908, Xesús Rodríguez López, Gallegadas, page 135:
      Amáñanse poñéndose moitos refaixos e cruzan os panos por diante o seo; todo pra aparentar máis gordas e rebustas: en vez de poñer as carnes ó aire, tápa-nas percurando aparecer que elas teñen moitas, aínda que falten pola casa. Dempois andan azoroñando a carón dos mozos i ós que queren pescar físga-nos polo rabiño do ollo. Si eles se fan de rogar entón carexan as mozas astra que miran pra elas
      They dress up with many underskirts and they cross the clothes before their bosom; all that so they seem fatter and more robust: instead of showing the flesh they cover it attempting to look as if they have much, even if it lacks at home. After this they wander around the boys, and the ones they want to fish, they catch them by the corner of the eye. If they play hard to get, then they speak together loudly till the boys look at them

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan pescar, from Latin piscārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

pescar

  1. to fish

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Galician-Portuguese pescar, from Latin piscārī. Compare Galician pescar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pesˈka(ʁ)/ [pesˈka(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pesˈka(ʁ)/ [pesˈka(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /pesˈka(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /peʃˈka(ʁ)/ [peʃˈka(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /pesˈka(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨʃˈkaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨʃˈkaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨʃˈka.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: pes‧car
  • Homophone: (central, southern Portugal) piscar

Verb

[edit]

pescar (first-person singular present pesco, first-person singular preterite pesquei, past participle pescado)

  1. to fish (try to catch fish)
  2. to remove an object from a body of water
  3. to fish (attempt to find an object by searching among other objects)
  4. (informal) to understand
  5. (Brazil, idiomatic, intransitive) to doze, to slumber (to sleep very briefly and unintentionally)
    Synonym: moscar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of pescar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person

(tu) 		Third-person

Derived terms

[edit]
  • pesca-siri
  • pesque-e-pague

Related terms

[edit]

Descendants

[edit]
  • Annobonese: piska

Romanian

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • păscar

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin piscārius.

Noun

[edit]

pescar m (plural pescari)

  1. fisher, fisherman

Declension

[edit]
singular plural
indefinite definite indefinite definite
nominative-accusative pescar pescarul pescari pescarii
genitive-dative pescar pescarului pescari pescarilor
vocative pescarule pescarilor

[edit]
  • pescăreasă
  • pescăresc
  • pescărie
  • pescărime
  • pescărit
  • pescăriță
  • pescăruș

Related terms

[edit]
  • pescui
  • pește

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin piscārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pesˈkaɾ/ [pesˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pes‧car

Verb

[edit]

pescar (first-person singular present pesco, first-person singular preterite pesqué, past participle pescado)

  1. to fish
  2. to angle
  3. (colloquial) to get
    Synonym: coger
  4. (colloquial) to catch
    Synonym: captar
  5. (colloquial) to mind, pay attention to (a person)
    Synonym: tomar en cuenta
  6. (colloquial) to search, or fish for information
  7. (colloquial) to screw, to get action (have sex)
